2.description: Removes the ability for an element’s tooltip to be shown. The tooltip will only be able to be shown if it is re-enabled.

3.description: Hides and destroys an element’s tooltip (Removes stored data on the DOM element). Tooltips that use delegation (which are created using the selector option) cannot be individually destroyed on descendant trigger elements.

4.description: Gives an element’s tooltip the ability to be shown. Tooltips are enabled by default.

5.description: Static method which allows you to get the tooltip instance associated with a DOM element, or create a new one in case it wasn’t initialized.

6.description: Static method which allows you to get the tooltip instance associated with a DOM element, or create a new one in case it wasn’t initialized.

7.description: Hides an element’s tooltip. Returns to the caller before the tooltip has actually been hidden (i.e. before the hidden.bs.tooltip event occurs). This is considered a “manual” triggering of the tooltip.

8.description: Gives a way to change the tooltip’s content after its initialization.

9.description: Reveals an element’s tooltip. Returns to the caller before the tooltip has actually been shown (i.e. before the shown.bs.tooltip event occurs). This is considered a “manual” triggering of the tooltip. Tooltips with zero-length titles are never displayed.

10.description: Toggles an element’s tooltip. Returns to the caller before the tooltip has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.tooltip or hidden.bs.tooltip event occurs). This is considered a “manual” triggering of the tooltip.

11.description: Toggles the ability for an element’s tooltip to be shown or hidden.

12.description: Updates the position of an element’s tooltip.
